unnormalised: Someone asked about the correct address for filing IT returns, huh? Well, finding a Gov address in India can feel like a treasure hunt guided by a slightly tipsy GPS. Don't even get me started on deciphering the abbreviations! You might end up sending your taxes to some random tea stall near a "Sector 17, Chandigarh, 160017" or something. Happened to a friend's cousin, I swear!
normalised: Someone asked about the correct address for filing I-T returns, huh? Well, finding a Government address in India can feel like a treasure hunt guided by a slightly tipsy G-P-S. Don't even get me started on deciphering the abbreviations! You might end up sending your taxes to some random tea stall near a "Sector seventeen, Chandigarh, one hundred and sixty thousand and seventeen" or something. Happened to a friend's cousin, I swear!

unnormalised: Seriously though, for IT returns, check the official Income Tax Dept. website. Don't trust just any address listed on random websites, especially if it looks like it was last updated in '98. Typically, they'll have something like "CPC Bangalore, Post Box No. 123, Karnataka, 560001". Make sure you get the PIN code right, or your returns might end up in some rural post office in Bihar. Imagine the chaos!
normalised: Seriously though, for I-T returns, check the official Income Tax Department website. Don't trust just any address listed on random websites, especially if it looks like it was last updated in ninety eight. Typically, they'll have something like "C-P-C Bangalore, Post Box Number one hundred and twenty three, Karnataka, five hundred and sixty thousand and one". Make sure you get the P-I-N code right, or your returns might end up in some rural post office in Bihar. Imagine the chaos!

unnormalised: And just a pro tip: if you're mailing it, write everything in CAPITAL letters. I heard some postal workers have a hard time reading fancy handwriting. Plus, it just screams "official business," right? Slap on some extra stamps too, just for good measure. Can't be too careful with the sarkar, bhai.
normalised: And just a pro tip: if you're mailing it, write everything in capital letters. I heard some postal workers have a hard time reading fancy handwriting. Plus, it just screams "official business," right? Slap on some extra stamps too, just for good measure. Can't be too careful with the sarkar, bhai.

unnormalised: But honestly, just file online. Save yourself the headache of dealing with postal addresses and the possibility of your precious tax returns getting lost somewhere between "New Delhi, 110001" and wherever they're supposed to go. Plus, you get a snazzy acknowledgment receipt instantly! Trust me, your sanity (and your returns) will thank you.
normalised: But honestly, just file online. Save yourself the headache of dealing with postal addresses and the possibility of your precious tax returns getting lost somewhere between "New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and one" and wherever they're supposed to go. Plus, you get a snazzy acknowledgment receipt instantly! Trust me, your sanity (and your returns) will thank you.
